body_html:
Hello, thanks for the very interesting course, I really enjoy it: fast-paced, no frills and very nutritive! :-)

I'm getting a Python 3 related error at this line of the fourth notebook:

layer3_weights = tf.Variable(tf.truncated_normal(
  [image_size / 4 * image_size / 4 * depth, num_hidden], stddev=0.1))

(sorry I cannot find a way to not render a notebook on GH, so I can't link to it):

TypeError: DataType float32 for attr 'T' not in list of allowed values: int32, int64

Using integer division solves it:

layer3_weights = tf.Variable(tf.truncated_normal(
  [image_size // 4 * image_size // 4 * depth, num_hidden], stddev=0.1))

body:
Hello, thanks for the very interesting course, I really enjoy it: fast-paced, no frills and very nutritive! :-)

I'm getting a Python 3 related error at this line of the fourth notebook:

```
layer3_weights = tf.Variable(tf.truncated_normal(
  [image_size / 4 * image_size / 4 * depth, num_hidden], stddev=0.1))
```

(sorry I cannot find a way to _not_ render a notebook on GH, so I can't link to it):

```
TypeError: DataType float32 for attr 'T' not in list of allowed values: int32, int64
```

Using integer division solves it:

```
layer3_weights = tf.Variable(tf.truncated_normal(
  [image_size // 4 * image_size // 4 * depth, num_hidden], stddev=0.1))
```
